feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 30 at 4:44PM AKDT until October 30 at 10:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM AKDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations 3 to 6 inches above 1500 feet on the Klondike Highway. * WHERE...Klondike Highway above 1500 feet. * WHEN...Until 10 PM AKDT this evening.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Haines Borough and Klukwan; Municipality of Skagway

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 30 at 11:55AM AKDT until October 31 at 7:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM AKDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 6 inches are expected along and near the Alaska Highway, with the highest amounts expected between Dot Lake and Tanacross. * WHERE...Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country. * WHEN...Until 7 AM AKDT Monday.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 30 at 8:12AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...STRONG SOUTHWEST WINDS CONTINUE TODAY... A wave of low pressure will track into the eastern gulf towards Cross Sound by late this afternoon. Along and south of the track of this low, enhanced southwest wind gusts are likely through the afternoon hours Sunday. Wind gusts out of the southwest of 50 mph with isolated higher gusts are likely from Sitka southward to Port
entry.cap:areaDesc: City and Borough of Sitka; Prince of Wales Island; Western Kupreanof and Kuiu Island

entry.title: Flood Statement issued October 30 at 2:24PM SST by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY CANCELLED... Heavy rain dissipated over the islands in the last few hours and floodings had subsided across the territory. && FAUTUAGA MO TAFEGA MA LOLOGA OFISA O LE TAU PAGO PAGO AS

entry.title: Beach Hazards Statement issued October 30 at 7:50PM PDT until October 31 at 9:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM PDT MONDAY THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Increased risk of sneaker waves, leading to larger and unexpected waves expected along the coast during the morning hours. entry.summary: ...FROST ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 2 AM TO 9 AM PDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Temperatures as low as 33 will result in frost formation. * WHERE...Southern Humboldt Interior, Northwestern Mendocino Interior and Northeastern Mendocino Interior Counties.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 30 at 2:03PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...EARLY SEASON STORM WILL BRING GUSTY WINDS, SNOWFALL, AND MUCH COLDER TEMPERATURES THIS WEEK... * STRONG AND GUSTY WINDS: Winds will increase Tuesday ahead of an approaching cold front. Gusts of 35 to 45 mph are likely in the valleys with gusts up to 55 mph in wind prone locations. Sierra ridgetop gusts may reach 100 mph. Impacts from winds include
entry.cap:areaDesc: Surprise Valley California

entry.title: Winter Storm Watch issued October 30 at 1:51PM PDT until November 02 at 5:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Above 5500 feet total snow accumulations 3 to 5 inches, with 5 to 12 inches above 7000 feet possible. West to southwest winds 45 to 50 mph, except along the ridges where wind gusts may reach up to 100 mph.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Greater Lake Tahoe Area; Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties; Mono

entry.title: Winter Storm Watch issued October 30 at 12:26PM PDT until November 02 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...First Significant Storm of the Wet Season Early This Week... A strong storm system will move out of the Gulf of Alaska on Monday and move into the Pacific Northwest on Monday night. We are expecting a strong cold front to move across the region on Tuesday night. Snow is expected to increase during the day on Tuesday with the potential heavy snow on Tuesday night. The front
entry.cap:areaDesc: Kaiser to Rodgers Ridge; Upper San Joaquin River; Yosemite NP outside of the valley

entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 30 at 8:35PM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Astor affecting Volusia and Lake Counties. .The forecast point at Astor remains in Moderate Flood Stage and has crested around 3.8 feet on Sunday due to recent north to northeast winds. River levels should resume a slow decline early this week while staying in Moderate Flood Stage.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lake; Volusia

entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 30 at 8:33PM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Deland affecting Volusia and Lake Counties. .The forecast point at Deland is forecast to remain in Moderate Flood Stage through this week while continuing a slow decline. Interests along the river will continue to see moderate flood impacts.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lake; Volusia

entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 30 at 8:32PM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Sanford affecting Seminole County. .The Saint Johns River at Sanford is forecast to remain in Moderate Flood Stage through next week while continuing a slow decline. Interests along the river will continue to see moderate flood impacts.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Seminole

entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 30 at 8:31PM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Above Lake Harney affecting Seminole County. .The St. Johns River above Lake Harney at Geneva is in Moderate Flood Stage and is forecast to continue a slow decline through Moderate Flood Stage into next week. Interests along the river will continue to see moderate flood impacts.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Seminole
